name: Kepler-278
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-278 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-278 is a star with 4.531999999999991 times the mass of the Sun, and 2.94 times its radius. It is located 1463.30 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-278 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-278 b

Kepler-278 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.21 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 30.16 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-278.

The mass of Kepler-278 b is 27.92 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-278 b is 4.07 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-278 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-278 c

Kepler-278 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.29 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 51.08 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-278.

The mass of Kepler-278 c is 20.63 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-278 c is 3.59 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-278 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-278, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
